developers.description: JavaScript, originally named LiveScript, was created by Brendan Eich while he was working at Netscape Communications Corporation in 1995. It was initially developed in a span of just 10 days as a scripting language for web browsers. The language was later renamed JavaScript to leverage the popularity of Java at that time, although the two languages are fundamentally different.
Known as the father of Java, a widely used programming language known for its platform independence.
Created Python, a popular programming language known for its simplicity and readability.
Co-created the C programming language, which has been influential in the development of many other languages and operating systems.
Created C++, an extension of the C programming language that added object-oriented programming features.
Developed Ruby, a dynamic, object-oriented scripting language known for its simplicity and productivity.
Created Perl, a high-level, general-purpose programming language often used for text manipulation and web development
Developed the Linux kernel, the core of the Linux operating system widely used in servers, supercomputers, and embedded systems.
Created TypeScript, a superset of JavaScript that adds static typing to the language.
Developed Node.js, a JavaScript runtime used for building scalable network applications.

It began as a personal project in 1994 when Lerdorf developed a set of Perl scripts to manage his personal webpage. He extended these scripts and combined them with some elements of C to create a more powerful tool for web development.
Co-created Ruby on Rails, a popular web application framework built using the Ruby programming language.
Jonathan R. is a frontend web developer. He started  his software engineering journey back in 2021 and is thriving in the tech industry.
